required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of 100% Orange Juice on Food Intake and Glycemic Response in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 100% Orange Juice Intake on Subjective Appetite, Food Intake, Glycemic Response and Subjective Mood in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of 100% orange juice on short-term food intake (FI), satiety, post-prandial glycemia and mood in healthy adults. We hypothesize that the consumption of 100% orange juice in the pre-meal environment will improve satiety signals and mood, and suppress FI through its effect on post-prandial glycemia.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized within-subjects repeated measures design will be employed. Study visits will take place in the morning, separated one-week apart. At each session, participants will consume one of three treatments: 1) 100% orange juice; 2) orange flavoured drink; or 3) water. Glycemic response will be measured for 60 minutes (baseline (0 minutes), 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes and 60 minutes) post-treatment via finger prick. Blood glucose measures will also be provided over 24 hours via a Dexcom G6 continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device. Subjective appetite, emotions and mood will be measured for 90 minutes min (baseline (0 minutes), 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 60 minutes and 90 minutes) post-treatment. At 60 minutes, participants will consume an ad libitum pizza lunch to evaluate food intake. After lunch, participants will be sent home with a rest-of-the-day food intake sheet to record their snacks, meals, and beverages, as well as a physical activity log to record their physical activity for the rest of the day following test session completion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline glycemic response (acute phase)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected at baseline (0 minutes), 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, and 60 minutes post-treatment consumption
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose (mmol/L). Three drops of blood from the finger will be collected at each time point using a single-use, auto-disabling lancet device and sodium fluoride/potassium oxalate capillary blood collection tubes. Blood glucose will be measured using a YSI 2900D Biochemistry Analyzer (YSI Inc., Yellow Springs, OH).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous measurements for 24 hours post-treatment consumption
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose (mmol/L). Rest-of-day blood glucose concentrations will be determined using a Dexcom G6 CGM system.
Lunch pizza meal. Food intake will be determined by weighing the meal before and after serving. The net weight of the test meal will be converted to calories.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected at baseline (0 minutes), 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, and 60 minutes post-treatment consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using visual analogue scales (VAS). Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings. Questions will include desire to eat, fullness, hunger, and prospective food consumption. Individual questions will be used to form a composite score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline subjective emotions and mood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected at baseline (0 minutes), 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, and 60 minutes post-treatment consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using visual analogue scales. Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings. Questions will measure aggression, anger, excitement, disappointment, frustration, alertness, sadness, tension, effort, happiness, weariness, calmness, sleepiness, and wellness. Individual questions will be used to form a composite score.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the rest of the day following test session completion (1 day)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be sent home with a rest-of-the-day food intake recall sheet to record their snacks, meals, and beverages. Rest of day food log

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the rest of the day following test session completion (1 day)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be sent home with a rest-of-the-day physical activity recall sheet to record any activities performed. Physical activity questionnaire

intervention.description: Matched for volume (240 mL/ 8 oz) of other test beverages. 100% orange juice (Tropicana Pure Premium Original, No Pulp) will provide 110 calories.
Matched for volume (240 mL/ 8 oz) of other test beverages. Orange flavoured drink (Fruité® Orange Drink) will provide 96 calories.
Matched for volume (240 mL/ 8 oz) of other test beverages. Control beverage (no caloric contribution).

facility.name: Centre for Urban Innovation (CUI-109), School of Nutrition, Ryerson University
